meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mealy.
meanings.sent1: The mealinesses of the apple made it unpleasant to eat.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the mealinesses of the flour between my fingers.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the mealinesses of the mashed potatoes were due to a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The mealinesses of the sand reminded me of the texture of flour.
meanings.sent5: The mealinesses of the cake left a powdery residue on my hands.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a texture resembling that of meal.
meanings.sent1: The mealinesses of the peach gave it a soft and grainy feel.
meanings.sent2: The mealinesses of the bread made it perfect for dipping in soup.
meanings.sent3: The mealinesses of the fabric made it comfortable to wear all day.
meanings.sent4: The mealinesses of the clouds made them look like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The mealinesses of the carpet felt cozy under my feet.
